person_1098.name: JohnWilliams
person_1098.description: The son of a Welsh miner, Williams was a mining engineer with forty years' experience. He worked in various locations in Scotland; in 1789 published The Natural History of the Mineral Kingdom. Died in Italy where he was carrying out further researches.

person_699.name: WilliamHamilton
person_699.description: English diplomat, politician, antiquarian, and vulcanologist who served as the Envoy Extraordinary to the Kingdom of Naples from 1764 to 1800. FRSL.

person_269.name: LuigiGalvani
person_269.description: Italian surgeon and anatomist who carried out experiments with electricity and animals. The term 'galvanism' was named after him

person_300.name: Déodat Gratet deDolomieu
person_300.description: French geologist. The rock, and region of the Alps, dolomite was named after him.

person_164.name: JamesHall
person_164.description: Scottish baronet (1776) and MP. Chemist and geologist who supported of James Hutton's theories of uniformitarian geology. FRSL.

person_261.name: GregoryWatt
person_261.description: Youngest son of James Watt. Lodged with Davy's mother in Penzance during the winter of 1797-8 and became close friends with Davy.

place_569.name: Sicily
place_569.description: Sicily is the largest and most populous island in the Mediterranean Sea and one of the twenty regions of Italy.

place_177.name: Andes
place_177.description: Mountain range in western South America.

place_184.name: Mount Etna
place_184.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

place_169.name: Mount Vesuvius
place_169.description: Mount Vesuvius is a somma-stratovolcano located on the Gulf of Naples in Campania, Italy.

place_528.name: Solfatara Caldera
place_528.description: Solfatara di Pozzuoli is a volcanic crater near Naples. Though a dormant volcano, it emits jets of steam and sulphurous fumes.

place_021.name: Cornwall
place_021.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

place_1359.name: Northumberland
place_1359.description: County in the North East of England. It borders Scotland to the north and the county of Cumbria to the west.

place_1012.name: Dorset
place_1012.description: A county in southwest England. It’s known for the Jurassic Coast, a long stretch on the English Channel where the cliffs contain many fossils, and rock formations show millions of years of geological history.

place_1388.name: Dysart
place_1388.description: Scottish town in Fife. Historically, its ports enabled trading with the Low Countries; the area mined and exported salt and coal.

place_1389.name: Birkwood Common
place_1389.description: Located in Normanton, Yorkshire, in the UK. Birkwood Common was thought to be the location of an archeological henge; this has since been reassessed as surface remnants of nearby shallow coal mining.

place_1390.name: Altofts
place_1390.description: Village located five miles from the centre of Wakefield, West Yorkshire, UK.

place_1391.name: Coalbrookdale
place_1391.description: Town located in the Ironbridge Gorge, Shropshire, UK. Famous for its history of iron ore smelting.

place_659.name: Shropshire
place_659.description: A county in the West Midlands of England.

place_1174.name: Stromboli
place_1174.description: an island in the Tyrrhenian Sea, off the north coast of Sicily, containing Mount Stromboli, one of the four active volcanoes in Italy. It is one of the seven Aeolian Islands, a volcanic arc north of Sicily.

place_408.name: Lipari
place_408.description: A commune including six of seven islands of the Aeolian Islands located in the Tyrrhenian Sea off the northern coast of Sicily in southern Italy.

place_085.name: Derbyshire
place_085.description: Derbyshire is a county in the East Midlands and includes part of the Peak District.

place_440.name: Darling Downs
place_440.description: The South Downs are a range of chalk hills extending from Hampshire to Sussex.

place_300.name: Wiltshire
place_300.description: A county in south-western England. The county town is Trowbridge.

place_1170.name: Antilles
place_1170.description: An archipelago bordered by the Caribbean Sea to the south and west, the Gulf of Mexico to the northwest, and the Atlantic Ocean to the north and east.

place_1395.name: Pacific Ocean
place_1395.description: The largest and deepest of Earth's five oceans.

otherwork_337.name: Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London
otherwork_337.author: John Stephens

otherwork_353.name: The Natural History of the Mineral Kingdom in Three Parts
otherwork_353.author: John Williams
